requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all stock data dynamically from backend APIs
user_persona: A financial analyst who needs up-to-date stock information.
user_goal: To retrieve real-time stock data without seeing any mock or cached content.

narrative_steps.title: Loading the Website
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the website and expects to see a clean interface ready for searching stocks.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a white background and navy UI components, with no static or preloaded stock data visible.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Stocks
narrative_steps.description: She types 'AAPL' into the search bar and hits enter, expecting fresh results from the backend.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'AAPL' into the search input and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The frontend makes a request to the backend API at `/api/stocks/search?q=AAPL`, and the results appear dynamically below the search bar.

requirement_tested: Backend API service that connects to external PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_goal: To confirm the backend is pulling accurate data from the correct PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Backend Request
narrative_steps.description: Mark submits a search query from the frontend which should trigger a database lookup.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'MSFT' in the search box and click 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend connects to PostgreSQL using the specified environment variables and retrieves Microsoft's stock record from the `stocks` table.

requirement_tested: Stock search functionality allowing users to input stock codes or names
user_persona: A new investor exploring different companies.
user_goal: To find stock information by entering either a company name or ticker symbol.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Ticker Code
narrative_steps.description: Jamie enters 'TSLA' into the search field and clicks Search.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'TSLA' into the search input and click the 'Search' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results matching Tesla Inc. are returned from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Company Name
narrative_steps.description: Next, Jamie tries typing the full company name instead.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Tesla Inc.' into the search input and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Same Tesla-related stock records are shown based on the name match.

requirement_tested: Report generation feature that creates customized stock reports based on user selections
user_persona: An investment manager preparing client reports.
user_goal: To generate a tailored report including selected sections like financials and market trends.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Stock and Options
narrative_steps.description: Alex chooses a stock from the search results and selects PDF format and specific content sections.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'GOOGL' from the results list, choose 'PDF' format, and check 'Financial Data' and 'Market Trends'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected options update the report configuration accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Generating the Report
narrative_steps.description: He clicks the Generate Report button to compile his custom report.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A request is sent to `/api/reports/generate`, and upon success, a formatted PDF preview appears in the report area.

requirement_tested: User interface for selecting report formats and content options
user_persona: A researcher needing flexible reporting tools.
user_goal: To customize what gets included in the generated stock report.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Format
narrative_steps.description: Taylor expands the dropdown menu to pick between HTML and PDF formats.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Select Format' dropdown and choose 'HTML'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dropdown closes and 'HTML' is now selected as the preferred format.

narrative_steps.title: Customizing Content Sections
narrative_steps.description: She decides to only include Basic Stock Information and Financial Data in her report.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Basic Stock Information' and 'Financial Data' checkboxes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only those two checkboxes remain checked, reflecting her choices.

requirement_tested: Display of basic stock information in generated reports
user_persona: A portfolio manager reviewing company fundamentals.
user_goal: To quickly access essential details like sector and industry in the report.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Generated Report
narrative_steps.description: Jordan generates a report and looks for the Basic Stock Information section.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' after selecting a stock and relevant options.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: After loading, the report shows a clearly labeled 'Basic Stock Information' section with symbol, name, sector, and industry.

requirement_tested: Inclusion of market trends data in stock reports
user_persona: A day trader analyzing price movements.
user_goal: To visualize historical price changes within the report.

narrative_steps.title: Including Market Trends
narrative_steps.description: Riley ensures that the Market Trends option is selected before generating the report.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Market Trends' checkbox and click 'Generate Report'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The generated report includes a visual chart showing recent price fluctuations sourced from the market_trends table.

requirement_tested: Integration of financial data in stock reports
user_persona: A financial auditor verifying company performance.
user_goal: To review multi-year financial metrics in a structured table.

narrative_steps.title: Requesting Financial Overview
narrative_steps.description: Cameron includes the Financial Data checkbox when generating a report.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Financial Data' and click 'Generate Report'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The report displays a table titled 'Financial Overview' with revenue, net income, and EPS values pulled from the financials table.

requirement_tested: White background color applied throughout the website
user_persona: A UX designer checking visual consistency.
user_goal: To verify the entire site maintains a uniform white background.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Page Background
narrative_steps.description: Dana navigates through various pages and scrolls down to ensure consistent background coloring.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage and scroll through the content areas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Every part of the page, including forms and footers, retains a solid white background (#FFFFFF).

requirement_tested: Navy color scheme for all UI components
user_persona: A brand compliance officer auditing the UI.
user_goal: To confirm all interactive elements follow the navy theme.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Button Colors
narrative_steps.description: Morgan inspects the primary buttons to ensure they're styled correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over and inspect the 'Search' and 'Generate Report' buttons.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both buttons display a navy background (#000080) with white text.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Active States
narrative_steps.description: She focuses on an input field to check if it follows the color scheme.
narrative_steps.action: Click inside the 'Search Stocks' input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The border of the focused input turns navy (#000080).

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for simultaneous frontend and backend dependency installation
user_persona: A DevOps engineer setting up a new project environment.
user_goal: To install all necessary dependencies efficiently with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Pat clones the repo and wants to get started quickly by installing all dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the terminal from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend folders are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'dev' script to concurrently start frontend and backend services
user_persona: A software developer beginning daily work.
user_goal: To launch both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Lee begins working on enhancements and needs both environments running locally.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run dev` from the root folder.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Terminal outputs show both frontend and backend servers starting concurrently, listening on their respective ports.

requirement_tested: Database operations strictly using the configured PostgreSQL connection
user_persona: A QA engineer ensuring data integrity.
user_goal: To validate that all data operations occur via the defined PostgreSQL setup.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Data Operation
narrative_steps.description: Casey searches for a stock to initiate a database read operation.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'AMZN' into the search bar and click 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend uses the configured PostgreSQL connection to fetch Amazon's data from the database.

requirement_tested: No hardcoded or mock data - all information fetched from backend APIs
user_persona: A product owner verifying authenticity of displayed data.
user_goal: To ensure no fake or static data appears during usage.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dynamic Data
narrative_steps.description: Reese performs a search and examines the returned data for signs of mock content.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'NFLX' in the search field and submit the query.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results reflect current Netflix stock data retrieved live from the backend API connected to the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design compatible with standard browser dimensions
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the platform remotely.
user_goal: To navigate and use the site seamlessly on smaller screens.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Mobile View
narrative_steps.description: Zoe resizes her browser window to simulate a mobile device viewport.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to 375x667 pixels and reload the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately with stacked elements, readable fonts, and accessible controls.
